title: W1: Practical exercise 1
text: Let ZnZ_n sequence iid r.v. Zn∼𝒩(0,1)∀nZ_n \sim \mathcal{N}(0,1) \, \forall n. Verify asymptotic distribution n(σ‾n2−μ(2))\sqrt{n}(\bar{\sigma}^2_n - \mu^{(2)}), μ(2)=E((Z1−E(Z1))2)\mu^{(2)} = E((Z_1 - E(Z_1))^2) First aim create various empiric elements: plot simulations compare expected distribution 𝒩(0,2)\mathcal{N}(0,2) see aligns nicely.
code: data <- rnorm(   n = 1000000,    mean = 0,    sd = 1 )  mu_2 <- 1 mu_4 <- 3  n <- length(data) i <- seq_len(n)  cum1 <- cumsum(data) cum2 <- cumsum(data^2)  m1 <- cum1 / i  m2 <- cum2 / i   sigma2_hat_1n <- function(x)  {  r <-  mean(x^2) - mean(x)^2  return(r) }  simulate_Tn <- function(     n,     B = 200 ) {   Z <- matrix(rnorm(n * B), nrow = n, ncol = B)   m1 <- colMeans(Z)   m2 <- colMeans(Z^2)   hatvar <- m2 - m1^2   sqrt(n) * (hatvar - 1) }   n <- 10000 B <- 20000 Tn <- simulate_Tn(n , B)  df <- tibble::tibble(Tn = Tn) ggplot2::ggplot(df, ggplot2::aes(Tn)) +    ggplot2::geom_density( linewidth = 1) +    ggplot2::stat_function(fun = dnorm, args = list(mean = 0, sd = sqrt(2)),                 linewidth = 1, color = "red")

title: W1: Practical exercise 1
text: Let ZnZ_n sequence iid r.v. ZnZ_n pareto shape α=3\alpha = 3 scale κ=100\kappa = 100 alle n.  Verify asymptotic distribution u=200u = 200 n(𝕖𝕟(𝕦)−𝕖𝔽(𝕦))\sqrt{n}(\mathbb{e_n(u) - e_F(u)})
